info.name: gp-testbox
info.description:
The test-box allows to create various cases fro auto-testing project.

version 4.1 (sometime before)
- debuged for login request (tests)
- created draft of auto-test AT04-02

version 4.2 (sometime before)
- added auto-test AT04-02

version 4.3 (sometime before)
- added auto-test AT04-03

version 4.4 (sometime before)
- added auto-test AT01-05
- added auto-test AT01-06

version 5.1 (07.10.2018 02:22 am)
- added new variables: "testResult", "test_cycle", "test_case" into requests with tests
- changed conditions for sending login reuest in 'GET /login'
- removed GET requests from tests
- added new logical block for sending requests with test-case results to Jira

version 5.2 (08.10.2018, 01:11 pm)
- made some changing of code (optimization)
- made some changing of data file

version 5.3
- made some changing of code (optimization)
- added block of code for case status FAIL or PASS

version 6.0
- added new AT01-07, AT01-08, AT01-09, AT01-10, AT01-11
- updated algorithm of generation account number
- edited test names for AT01-10, AT01-11, AT01-12, AT01-13, AT01-14

version 6.1
- Added output results for tests in the POST request payment-method

header.value: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/62.0.3202.94 Safari/537.36
Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/62.0.3202.94 Safari/537.36

header.name: Cache-Control
header.description: Tells all caching mechanisms from server to client whether they may cache this object. It is measured in seconds

header.name: Connection
header.description: Options that are desired for the connection

header.name: Content-Length
header.description: The length of the response body in octets (8-bit bytes)

header.name: Content-Type
header.description: The mime type of this content

header.name: Date
header.description: The date and time that the message was sent

header.name: Expires
header.description: Gives the date/time after which the response is considered stale

header.name: Pragma
header.description: Implementation-specific headers that may have various effects anywhere along the request-response chain.

header.name: X-Powered-By
header.description: Specifies the technology (ASP.NET, PHP, JBoss, e.g.) supporting the web application (version details are often in X-Runtime, X-Version, or X-AspNet-Version)
